member.name: T:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter
member.summary: An implementation of a MTConnect Adapter that publishes data thru a TCP stream.

member.name: E:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.ClientDataReceived
member.summary: Event that fires when a response is received from a .

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.Port
member.summary: The Port property to set and get the mPort. This will only take affect when the adapter is stopped.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.MaxConnections
member.summary: The maximum number of kvp connections allowed to exist at any given point.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter._listenerThread
member.summary: The listening thread for new connections

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter._clients
member.summary: A list of all the kvp connections.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.CurrentConnections
member.summary: A count of how many clients are currently connected to the TCP listener.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter._listener
member.summary: The server socket.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.ReceivedDataModel
member.summary: A flag for whether or not the underlying has indicated that it received an . This is used to determine whether or not to send a Device Model to a new connection.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.CanSendDataModel
member.summary: A flag indicating whether or not a Device Model should be generated and sent to client(s).

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.#ctor(Mtconnect.TcpAdapterOptions,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory)
member.summary: Constructs a new .

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.HandleDataModelChanges(Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IAdapter,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends the following Agent commands to the client(s)
* mtconnectVersion: XXX
* device: XXX
* serialNumber: XXX
* station: XXX
* deviceModel: ...; Only if allowed based on configuration.
member.param: Reference to a specific client to send the commands to. If null, then the commands are sent to all client(s).

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.FlushAll
member.summary: Flush all the communications to all the clients TODO: Exception handling.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.ListenForClients
member.summary: Listens for new TCP clients.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpAdapter.Client_OnReceivedData(Mtconnect.TcpConnection,System.String)
member.summary: ReceiveClient data from a kvp and implement heartbeat ping/pong protocol.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.TcpAdapterOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for a .

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapterOptions.Address
member.summary: The IP Address for which the Adapter should stream data thru.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapterOptions.Port
member.summary: The port for which the Adapter should stream data thru.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapterOptions.MaxConcurrentConnections
member.summary: The maximum number of connections allowed at any given point.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpAdapterOptions.SendDeviceModel
member.summary: Flag that indicates whether or not the TCP Adapter should automatically generate and send the Device Model to client(s).

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpAdapterOptions.#ctor(System.Double,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs the most basic options for configuring a MTConnect Adapter.

member.name: E:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.OnConnected
member.summary: An event that fires when the underlying client stream is opened and connected.

member.name: E:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.OnDisconnected
member.summary: An event that fires when the underlying client stream is closed and disconnected.

member.name: E:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.OnDataReceived
member.summary: An event that fires when data is fully parsed from the underlying client stream. Note that a new line is used to determine the end of a full message.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.BUFFER_SIZE
member.summary: Maximum amount of binary data to receive at a time.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.ClientId
member.summary: Reference to the address.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.Heartbeat
member.summary: The period of time (in milliseconds) to timeout stream reading.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpConnection._client
member.summary: Reference to the connection to the .

member.name: P:Mtconnect.TcpConnection._stream
member.summary: Reference to the underlying client stream. Note, only available between and calls.

member.summary: Constructs a new TCP connection

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.Connect
member.summary: Connects the underlying client stream and begins receiving data.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.Disconnect(System.Exception)
member.summary: Disconnects the underlying client stream and disposes of it. Note that this leaves the connection to the TCP client alone.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a message to the underlying client stream.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes a binary message to the underlying client stream.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the underlying client stream.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.TcpConnection.receive
member.summary: Continuously reads messages from the underlying client stream.
